metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15406 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A stack buffer overflow in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 62.0.3202.75 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15406` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
chromium-browser-l10n - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
chromium-chromedriver - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3202.75-0ubuntu0.16.04.1313').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
